title: Episode 282: Le Tigre
description: “Deceptacon” LISTEN: APPLE · SPOTIFY · AMAZON · OTHER APPS Le Tigre originally formed in 1998. They released their self-titled debut album in October 1999. Spin Magazine called it one of the best albums of the past 30 years, and Pitchfork called it one of the best albums of the 90s. title: Episode 281: Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young
description: “Our House” LISTEN: APPLE · SPOTIFY · AMAZON · OTHER APPS In 1968, singer and songwriter Graham Nash joined David Crosby and Stephen Stills to form the supergroup Crosby, Stills and Nash. title: Judge in Diddy Case Orders Prosecutors Not to Use Papers Seized During Sweep of Jail Cell
description: The hip-hop mogul's lawyers argued that 19 pages photographed by an investigator during the sweep are protected by attorney-client privilege.

title: ‘Something’ Special: Eric Benét & Tamar Braxton Top Adult R&B Airplay
description: The duet gives both artists a first No. 1 on the radio ranking in more than a decade, after some close No. 2 finishes.

title: Blueprint Gears Up for Huge Holiday Season With deadmau5, Seven Lions and More
description: The Vancouver-based event organizer is set to light up the holiday season with a dizzying blend of top DJs, immersive venues and eye-popping visuals.

title: Skrillex's Next Album Will Be His Last Before Going Independent
description: Taking to X to share a candid thread, the dubstep icon opened up about releasing music as an independent artist in 2025.
